00028 #ifndef HARDWARE_INTERFACE_JOINT_COMMAND_INTERFACE_H
00029 #define HARDWARE_INTERFACE_JOINT_COMMAND_INTERFACE_H
00030 
00031 #include <hardware_interface/joint_state_interface.h>
00032 
00033 
00034 namespace hardware_interface
00035 {
00036 
00039 class JointHandle : public JointStateHandle
00040 {
00041 public:
00042   JointHandle() {};
00043   JointHandle(const JointStateHandle& js, double* cmd)
00044     : JointStateHandle(js), cmd_(cmd)
00045   {}
00046   void setCommand(double command) {*cmd_ = command;};
00047 
00048 private:
00049   double* cmd_;
00050 };
00051 
00052 
00062 class JointCommandInterface : public hardware_interface::HardwareInterface
00063 {
00064 public:
00066   std::vector<std::string> getJointNames() const
00067   {
00068     std::vector<std::string> out;
00069     out.reserve(handle_map_.size());
00070     for( HandleMap::const_iterator it = handle_map_.begin(); it != handle_map_.end(); ++it)
00071     {
00072       out.push_back(it->first);
00073     }
00074     return out;
00075   }
00076 
00082   void registerJoint(const JointStateHandle& js, double* cmd)
00083   {
00084     JointHandle handle(js, cmd);
00085     HandleMap::iterator it = handle_map_.find(js.getName());
00086     if (it == handle_map_.end())
00087       handle_map_.insert(std::make_pair(js.getName(), handle));
00088     else
00089       it->second = handle;
00090   }
00091 
00103   JointHandle getJointHandle(const std::string& name)
00104   {
00105     HandleMap::const_iterator it = handle_map_.find(name);
00106 
00107     if (it == handle_map_.end())
00108       throw HardwareInterfaceException("Could not find joint [" + name + "] in EffortJointInterface");
00109 
00110     HardwareInterface::claim(name);
00111     return it->second;
00112   }
00113 
00114 protected:
00115   typedef std::map<std::string, JointHandle> HandleMap;
00116   HandleMap handle_map_;
00117 };
00118
